verses.verse: {Elam and Media are Rebuked} d A message {Lit. An oracle} concerning the pasture {Or plague ; cf. Isa 5:17; 1King 8:37; Jer 14:12; MT LXX read wilderness} by the Sea. "Like whirlwinds in the Negev {I. e. southern regions of the Sinai peninsula; cf. Josh 10:40} sweep on, it comes from the desert, from a distant {So 1QIsa a ; 1QIsa a corrector MT LXX read terrible} land.
A dire vision has been announced to me: the traitor betrays, and the plunderer takes loot. Get up, Elam! Attack, Media! I am putting a stop to all the groaning she has caused.

Therefore my body is {Or waist ; lit. my hips and lower back are} racked with pain; pangs have seized me, like the pangs of a woman in labor; I am so upset that I cannot hear; I am so frightened that I cannot see while I'm reeling around. {So 1QIsa a 4QIsa a ; MT LXX begin v. 4 with this line}
And as for my heart, {So 1QIsa a 4QIsa a ; MT LXX read 4 My mind reels} horror has terrified me; the twilight I longed for has started to make me tremble.
They set the tables; they spread the carpets; {So 1QIsa a MT; LXX lacks this line} they eat, they drink! Get up, you officers! Oil the shields!"
{The Fall of Babylon} d For this is what the Lord told me: "Go post a lookout. Have him report what he sees.

When he sees chariots, each man {So 1QIsa a 4QIsa a ; cf. v. 9; MT LXX lack each man} with a pair of horses, riders on donkeys or riders on {So 1QIsa a LXX; MT reads train of donkeys or train of} camels, let him pay attention, full attention."
Then the lookout {So 1QIsa a Syr; MT reads Then a lion} shouted: "Upon a watchtower I stand, O Lord, continually by day, and I am stationed at my post throughout the night.

Look! Here come riders, {So 1QIsa a LXX; MT reads chariot ; cf. v. 7} each man with a pair of horses!" They're shouting out the answer: "Babylon has fallen, has fallen, and they have shattered all the images of her gods {So 1QIsa a ; LXX reads all the images of her gods are shattered ; MT reads He has shattered all the images of her gods} on the ground!
O my downtrodden people, {1QIsa a lacks people} my wall! {So 1QIsa a ; MT reads my threshing floor} I'll tell you what I have heard from the Lord of the Heavenly Armies, the God of Israel."

{A Message about Dumah} d A message {Lit. An oracle} concerning Dumah. "Someone is calling to me from Seir: «Watchman, what is left of the night? {Or What time of night?} Watchman, what is left of the night? '{Or What time of night?}
The watchman replies: «Morning is coming, but also the night. If you want to ask, then ask; come back again.»"
{A Message about Arabia} d A message {Lit. An oracle} concerning Arabia. "You will camp in the thickets in Arabia, you caravans of the Dedanites.
Bring water for the thirsty, you who live in the land of Tema. Meet the fugitive with bread, {So 1QIsa a LXX; MT reads with his bread ; 4QIsa a reads and with his bread}
For he has fled {So 1QIsa a ; MT reads they have fled} from swords, from the drawn sword, from the bent bow, and from the heat of battle."

For this is what the Lord {So 1QIsa a 4QIsa a ; MT reads Lord} is saying to me: "Within three years, {So 1QIsa a ; MT LXX read Within a year} according to the years of a contract worker, {I. e. as if carefully counted pursuant to an employment contract; cf. Isa 16:14} the pomp {So 1QIsa a LXX; MT reads years, all the pomp} of Kedar will come to an end.
And there will be few archers, those who are descendants of Kedar, who survive, because the Lord , the God of Israel, has spoken."
